column5: Effective immediately, the 2020 Toronto Sportsmen's Show (March 18-22), which was set to take place at The International Centre in Mississauga, will not be opening. In the 73-year history of the Toronto Sportsmen's Show, this is the first time it has had to suspend the event. This action is being taken based on the recommendations made by the provincial Chief Medical Officer of Health and Peel Public Health to help reduce possible risk regarding the spread of COVID-19 (Coronavirus). Attendees who have already purchased tickets will be notified by email. TSS staff will contact exhibitors as soon as possible with more information.
Bummer
figured that was coming
I'm wondering if Hamilton Bassmasters swap meet will be cancelled as well? Might be in everyone's best interest if it is.

Everything gets wipes down with cleaner here that we both touch. Faucet,door handles what ever we come in contact daily.Â  Not sure if I am over reacting,but I don't feel like getting sick for this 2 week lock down they have in place . Got a freezer full of stuff to cook up. Was atÂ  Brants factory and Starskys this morning. Loaded up . Going to make a mash potato,herring and beet salad this weekend.

This is a historic time in our modern society. Most of us are boomers or of later generations. The last time in history that society has been effected this much would be WW2 in my estimation. Cancelling any function where large numbers are involved is prudent. My God Daughter's wedding is coming up in mid April. 300 invited, what to do?

Occasions like that only happen once,Â  I would look at the good and the bad side of things and weigh the pro's and con's.Â  Maybe the bug will minimize by then, who knows.Â  Personally I would opt out and hope they understand that the elder population is much more vulnerable than the young ones.

My thinking exactly Fisherman, postpone for now. Even if the risk of a large gathering has diminished by the time her day has arrived the couple will need to make a decision ASAP. Not something one can postpone a week before the event without huge ramifications and associated costs for both the couple, the Family and guests.Â  Her Father told me today that she is devastated. In the scheme of all things it's easy for someone to tell her that her nuptials are not as important as the Health and Safety of her loved ones that are to attend. But try telling that to a 24 year old bride to be. We will be visiting them this Sunday.
